realize.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it
realize.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
It was only later that I realized my mistake.
I suddenly realized that the boy was crying.
Do you realize you’re an hour late?
I’m sorry, I didn’t realize who you were.
realize.translation[0].definitions[0].no: In this meaning, realize is not usually used in the progressive You say
Nobody realizes how important this is
Nobody is realizing how important this is
In spoken English, people sometimes say I’m realizing to say that they have recently begun to realize something
Now I’m a parent, I’m realizing what my parents went through
realize.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to achieve something that you were hoping to achieve
realize.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
a young singer who has not yet realized her full potential (=achieved as much as she can achieve)
realize.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to obtain or earn an amount of money
realize.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: We realized a small profit on the sale of the house.
realize.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to change something that you own into money by selling it
realize.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: realize
to begin to understand, notice, or know something that you did not understand etc before
I hadn’t realized that Ben was his brother.
She suddenly realized who the man in the photograph was.
become aware
to gradually realize that something is happening or is true, over a period of time
He slowly became aware that he was not alone
People are becoming more aware of the harmful effects of cars on the environment.
dawn on somebody
if something dawns on you, you realize it for the first time – often used in the phrase it dawned on somebody
It dawned on me that he could be lying.
It only dawned on her that she was in danger when she saw rescue workers running away from the building.
He thought about the dream for a long time before its meaning began to dawn on him.
sink in
if something sinks in, you begin to realize its full meaning or importance, especially gradually
It took a few minutes for the doctor’s words to sink in.
The reality of what I had done slowly began to sink in.
if a fact hits you, you suddenly understand it and how important it is
It hit me one day that he didn’t care. He’d talk when I phoned him, but he’d never call me.
strike
if an idea or thought strikes you, you suddenly think of it
It suddenly struck her what a risk she was taking.
A thought has just struck me - there must be other people with the same problem.
realize.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: He estimated they could realize $115 million on the sale before taxes.
The company was able to realize a 35% increase in operating profit.
realize.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to sell something that has increased in value or lost value
realize.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: People rushed to realize gains because the capital gains tax rate was about to rise.
The bank will realize losses from sales of certain parts of its investment portfolio.
realize.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to sell assets that you own in order to make money
realize.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: They have three years to realize the firm’s assets and pay back as much of the debt as possible.
realize.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to achieve something that you were hoping to achieve
realize.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: Both of these boys realized their ambitions and become successful solicitors.
